description:
exp/publicsuffix: new package

Package publicsuffix provides a built-in list of known
public suffixes of domain names. The list of rules is taken
from http://publicsuffix.org/.

The 75 kbyte long list of rules effective_tld_names.dat
is encoded to two const strings with together 65 kbytes.
Looking up the public suffix of a domain is efficient even
for TLDs with lots of rules like jp.

Update issue 1960

messages.text:
Hello nigeltao@golang.org, rsc@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

I would like to find a better way to do this.
This is a lot of data to carry around in the repo history forever
and the encoding does not seem to be decided yet.
At the least the data file does not belong here and should
be fetched during the building of the Go table, like we do
in package unicode.

subject: code review 6864047: exp/publicsuffix: new package
